#Text=Wikinews interviews the Socialist Alliance about the upcoming Queensland State election
#Text=Monday , March 2 , 2009
#Text=With a Queensland state election coming up in Australia , many minor parties will be looking to hold balance of power and making the major parties listen to what they have to say .
#Text=The Socialist Alliance ( SA ) is one of these parties .
#Text=SA is a left-wing political party .

#Text=There stated describes itself as an anti-capitalist party which believes in " a democratic society that is run by and for working people , not the tiny , greedy , destructive elite that now rules .

#Text=Having someone who speaks uncompromisingly for the oppressed and voiceless - working people , the unemployed , students , Indigenous people - in the  parliamentary pit " would help expose the lack of democracy in a parliamentary system that favours those with wealth and resources .

column1: #Text=It would boost the resources and media profile for socialist solutions .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) What are the three main policies you will take into this election ?
#Text=Paul Benedek : 1. Free public transport & mass investment in renewables to address the climate emergency .
#Text=Unbelievably , the current government is looking to triple coal production in the biggest coal exporting state , in the biggest coal exporting country in the world !
#Text=Meanwhile , the only solution we have to atrocious traffic and car dependence is ... . more roads , more tunnels , more bridges !
#Text=Socialist Alliance says we need free public transport to get cars off the road , and provide quality alternatives to all people , regardless of wealth .
#Text=In the Belgian city of Hasselt , free public transport saw an 800 % increase in usage in one year !
#Text=Socialist Alliance says move on renewable energy rather than more coal mines , and provide retraining for fossil fuel workers in green jobs .
#Text=2. Bailout people and communities , not corporations .
#Text=With the worst economic crisis since the 1930s Great Depression , working people are being hit hard - and its going to get worse .
#Text=The major parties are united in wanting to bail out business - but it 's their ' profits before all else ' focus that has caused this disaster .
#Text=Socialist Alliance says we need to defend communities not profits , supporting workers , investing in public housing , health and education .
#Text=With Sam Watson running in South Brisbane , we will also have an emphasis on justice for Aboriginal people .
#Text=3. Make government genuinely accountable to the people .
#Text=We are seeing a LNP " opposition " with big business 's hands all over it , and the Labor Government which charges thousands of dollars to sit down with Ministers for lunch .
#Text=Socialist Alliance call for an end to this undemocratic farce .
#Text=We need community referenda , not fake “ consultation ” .
#Text=An end to cronyism and private factional deals and manipulation .
#Text=Fixed of government to prevent manipulation for self-interested gain .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) How will you address these policies ?
#Text=Paul Benedek :
#Text=These are policies that Socialist Alliance fights for on a daily basis , and helps to build movements for .
#Text=We publish the progressive newspaper Green Left Weekly ( www.greenleft.org.au ) which provides an excellent alternative to the corporate media .
#Text=On the environment front , we are involved in the climate justice movement in Brisbane and around the country .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) Who will lead your party if you gain more than one or two seats in parliament ?
#Text=Paul Benedek :
#Text=Socialist Alliance is a truly democratic organisation , with a collective leadership .
#Text=A key spokesperson for our party would be Aboriginal activist Sam Watson ( our candidate for South Brisbane ) .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) )
#Text=If you ca n't form government , who would you like to see do so ?
#Text=Paul Benedek :
#Text=We want to see the most progressive government possible .
#Text=We would like to see as many Greens elected as possible .
#Text=We see both Labor and the LNP as big business parties that are almost like choosing between Coke and Pepsi !
#Text=However , we generally favour Labor over the LNP , as being a slightly lesser evil .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) What should Queenslanders keep in mind , when heading to the polls ?

#Text=Paul Benedek : That choosing between " tweedledee " and " tweedledum " once every few years is not real democracy , and with the planet in peril , facing an economic meltdown , and all manner of social problems , we ca n't afford to leave sociaety [ sic ] in the hands of the pro-corporate parties .

#Text=No matter what the vote is , the struggle will continue in the communities , and while voting can be part of changing the world , its people 's power that has always made the most important , progressive changes .
